activity: Look up how "design" is written in 3 languages
find 3 album cover designs that inspire you
Use Adobe Illustrator to sketch 5 logos in 5 minutes
Play with type on https://pangrampangram.com
Reorganize your Figma file covers
Take a photo of an interesting texture or shadow and play around with it in PS
Create a 2-color palette inspired by your outfit
Sketch 3 effective landing page designs
Scroll Pinterest for food truck branding inspo
Redesign the WhatsApp group icon for your cohort like it’s a global design agency

Blind Contour Doodle
Draw your coffee mug (or your hand) without looking at the paper.

Micro Moodboard
Tear out 3 textures/colors from a magazine that describe your current vibe.

Type Treasure Hunt
Spot and sketch 3 different typefaces in your space.
Glance around. Pick one object. Sketch a minimalist logo for it in under 5 strokes.
On a sticky note, sketch the homepage of a fake app for your lunch, your pen, or your plant.
Draw 2 quick layouts: one with too little contrast, one with too much. Which feels better?
Create a 3-word phrase and write it in 3 different visual hierarchies: bold, size, placement.
Fold a piece of paper into 6 or 8 sections. Use each box to experiment with layout or spacing—no tools, just intuition.
Take a familiar logo and redesign it badly on purpose. What makes it feel “wrong”? Instant design gut check.
Invent a fake design studio. In 1 minute: Name it. In 2 minutes: Sketch the logotype or wordmark.

Take 5 words: vintage, slick, loud, soft, expensive. Make each one a vibe.
